00001 ########################################################################### 
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the Point object
00004 #
00005 package Value::Point;
00006 my $pkg = 'Value::Point';
00007 
00008 use strict; no strict "refs";
00009 our @ISA = qw(Value);
00010 
00011 #
00012 #  Convert a value to a point.  The value can be
00013 #    a list of numbers, or an reference to an array of numbers
00014 #    a point or vector object (demote a vector)
00015 #    a matrix if it is  n x 1  or  1 x n
00016 #    a string that evaluates to a point
00017 #
00018 sub new {
00019   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00020   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00021   my $p = shift; $p = [$p,@_] if scalar(@_) > 0;
00022   $p = Value::makeValue($p,context=>$context) if defined($p) && !ref($p);
00023   return $p if Value::isFormula($p) && Value::classMatch($self,$p->type);
00024   my $isFormula = 0; my @d; @d = $p->dimensions if Value::classMatch($p,'Matrix');
00025   if (Value::classMatch($p,'Point','Vector')) {$p = $p->data}
00026   elsif (scalar(@d) == 1) {$p = [$p->value]}
00027   elsif (scalar(@d) == 2 && $d[0] == 1) {$p = ($p->value)[0]}
00028   elsif (scalar(@d) == 2 && $d[1] == 1) {$p = ($p->transpose->value)[0]}
00029   else {
00030     $p = [$p] if defined($p) && ref($p) ne 'ARRAY';
00031     Value::Error("Points must have at least one coordinate")
00032       unless defined($p) && scalar(@{$p}) > 0;
00033     foreach my $x (@{$p}) {
00034       $x = Value::makeValue($x,context=>$context);
00035       $isFormula = 1 if Value::isFormula($x);
00036       Value::Error("Coordinate of Point can't be %s",Value::showClass($x))
00037         unless Value::isNumber($x);
00038     }
00039   }
00040   return $self->formula($p) if $isFormula;
00041   bless {data => $p, context=>$context}, $class;
00042 }
00043 
00044 #
00045 #  Try to promote arbitrary data to a point
00046 #
00047 sub promote {
00048   my $self = shift; my $class = ref($self) || $self;
00049   my $context = (Value::isContext($_[0]) ? shift : $self->context);
00050   my $x = (scalar(@_) ? shift: $self);
00051   return $self->new($context,$x,@_) if scalar(@_) > 0 || ref($x) eq 'ARRAY';
00052   $x = Value::makeValue($x,context=>$context);
00053   return $x->inContext($context) if ref($x) eq $class;
00054   Value::Error("Can't convert %s to %s",Value::showClass($x),Value::showClass($self));
00055 }
00056 
00057 ############################################
00058 #
00059 #  Operations on points
00060 #
00061 
00062 sub add {
00063   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00064   my @l = $l->value; my @r = $r->value;
00065   Value::Error("Can't add Points with different numbers of coordinates")
00066     unless scalar(@l) == scalar(@r);
00067   my @s = ();
00068   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@l)-1) {push(@s,$l[$i] + $r[$i])}
00069   return $self->inherit($other)->make(@s);
00070 }
00071 
00072 sub sub {
00073   my ($self,$l,$r,$other) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00074   my @l = $l->value; my @r = $r->value;
00075   Value::Error("Can't subtract Points with different numbers of coordinates")
00076     unless scalar(@l) == scalar(@r);
00077   my @s = ();
00078   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@l)-1) {push(@s,$l[$i] - $r[$i])}
00079   return $self->inherit($other)->make(@s);
00080 }
00081 
00082 sub mult {
00083   my ($l,$r) = @_; my $self = $l;
00084   Value::Error("Points can only be multiplied by Numbers")
00085     unless (Value::matchNumber($r) || Value::isComplex($r));
00086   my @coords = ();
00087   foreach my $x ($l->value) {push(@coords,$x*$r)}
00088   return $self->make(@coords);
00089 }
00090 
00091 sub div {
00092   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_; my $self = $l;
00093   Value::Error("Can't divide by a Point") if $flag;
00094   Value::Error("Points can only be divided by Numbers")
00095     unless (Value::matchNumber($r) || Value::isComplex($r));
00096   Value::Error("Division by zero") if $r == 0;
00097   my @coords = ();
00098   foreach my $x ($l->value) {push(@coords,$x/$r)}
00099   return $self->make(@coords);
00100 }
00101 
00102 sub power {
00103   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_;
00104   Value::Error("Can't raise Points to powers") unless $flag;
00105   Value::Error("Can't use Points in exponents");
00106 }
00107 
00108 #
00109 #  Promote to vectors and do it there
00110 #
00111 sub cross {
00112   my ($l,$r,$flag) = @_;
00113   my $context = $l->context;
00114   $l = $context->Package("Vector")->promote($context,$l);
00115   $l->cross($r,$flag);
00116 }
00117 
00118 #
00119 #  If points are different length, shorter is smaller,
00120 #  Otherwise, do lexicographic comparison.
00121 #
00122 sub compare {
00123   my ($self,$l,$r) = Value::checkOpOrderWithPromote(@_);
00124   my @l = $l->value; my @r = $r->value;
00125   return scalar(@l) <=> scalar(@r) unless scalar(@l) == scalar(@r);
00126   my $cmp = 0;
00127   foreach my $i (0..scalar(@l)-1) {
00128     $cmp = $l[$i] <=> $r[$i];
00129     last if $cmp;
00130   }
00131   return $cmp;
00132 }
00133 
00134 sub neg {
00135   my $self = promote(@_); my @coords = ();
00136   foreach my $x ($self->value) {push(@coords,-$x)}
00137   return $self->make(@coords);
00138 }
00139 
00140 #
00141 #  abs() is norm of vector
00142 #
00143 sub abs {
00144   my $self = promote(@_); my $s = 0;
00145   foreach my $x ($self->value) {$s += $x*$x}
00146   return CORE::sqrt($s);
00147 }
